result.execSummary:
The defendant Dante D Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: All Court costs, fees, surcharges including DNA, all applicable fees of supervision.
All Court costs, surcharges to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under sEc. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence/counts.  Credit for 135 days.

superMiscConds.notes: No alcohol or drugs.  No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohl.
Follow all rules of supervision.  Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence/count. Credit for 135 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dante D Smith

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS ATTN. RECORDS 2909 E PARK AVE. CHIPPEWA FALLS WI 54729. OS
Amendment to Judgement of Conviction and Order - ERP, recieved and filed.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 24, Judge Protasiewicz.
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

AS TO COUNT 1
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS 6 MONTHS  with  135 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is  3  YEARS 6 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2
The Court sentenced the defendant to a 1 YEAR  in the House of Corrections with 135 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; 

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and/or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
- All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
- All applicable fees of supervision.
- Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Dante D Smith in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution and proceeds to plea and sentencing. Court vacates the Jury trial calendared for May 31, 2016
Plea hearing held: 

AS TO COUNT 1 AND COUNT 2
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

 Case proceeds to  sentencing in Branch 22.

Attorney Virginia m Stuller in court, defendant Dante D Smith not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Court grants Defense motion for adjourned final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND due 06/08/2016.

Case in court for final pre-trial.  Court grants Defense motion for adjourned final pre-trial and jury trial.  Jury trial date of 03/21/2016 is vacated.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dante D Smith in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.  Defendant Dante D Smith in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court grants defendant's request for substitution of attorney Stuller for attorney Williamson.  Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Attorneys signed and filed.

Attorney Chelsea Williamson in court, defendant Dante D Smith not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Scheduling conference, defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Dante D Smith in court with attorney Chelsea Williamson.  Defendant Dante D Smith in custody.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Fox Tavern: 421 W Keefe Ave
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Dante D Smith in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Dante D Smith in custody.  
Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     

Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
